results.title: A Kind of seeing: the colour of Scotland
results.creator_credit: Edward McConnell, Films of Scotland and IFA (Scotland)
results.brief_description: An abstract colour impression of Scotland throughout the four seasons of the year. The camera focused on flowers, the surface of ponds and the winter sky. There is no commentary, the background music was composed by Frank Spedding.

results.title: A Killing rain (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Taylor, BBC-TV and United Nations Environment Programme
results.brief_description: Acid rain is one aspect of environmental pollution discussed at the Public Hearing in London in 1982. This program travels from Scotland to Scandinavia to West Germany to uncover background causes and the effects of this major pollution problem of the 80s.

results.title: A Kibbutz
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the establishment of the kibbutz. Describes community organisation, and the changing role of women on the kibbutz. Shows the progress of a child through the system. Discussion ensues when two of the haberim wish to leave the kibbutz - problems and advantages are aired.

results.title: A Journey that wasn't
results.brief_description: A Journey that wasn’t is a colour video work that intersperses footage of an expedition to the Antarctic circle with shots of a concert held on an ice rink in Central Park, New York. Aside from a brief voice-over early in the film that provides a small amount of background information about the expedition, the rest of the work is not narrated.

results.title: A is for AIDS
results.creator_credit: Aron Ranen, Charlotte K. Beyers and Peregrine Productions
results.brief_description: Made for children at primary-school level, this program features Dr. Andy Answer, an animated dog, who explains to three young children some of the facts about AIDS. Using computer animation, interviews with young children who are HIV Positive, and clear and simple illustrations the video explains how the HIV virus is transmitted and how the immune system works. The video dispels many of the myths about the disease and features excerpts from the Magic Johnson press conference where the basketballer revealed his positive status and argued against discrimination and prejudice.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aron Ranen, Charlotte K. Beyers and Peregrine Productions

results.brief_description: SUMMARY: A record of the work carried out by the Department of Civil Engineering at the University of Salford to determine the optimum configuration of Skerton Weir and of its fish ladder by the use of models

results.title: A Hundred years underground
results.creator_credit: Jon Rowdon, Edgar H. Anstey, John Shearman, BBC-TV and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: The story of London’s underground railway, from the building of the original Metropolitan line with its steam drawn trains, to its latest addition, the ultra modern Victorian line. Lord Morrison tells how London Transport became the model for similar undertakings throughout the world; artist Henry Moore shows how the tube became a wartime refuge, and tunnel engineers explain the problems, past, present and future, of building and operating this vast system.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jon Rowdon, Edgar H. Anstey, John Shearman, BBC-TV and British Transport Films
